conclusion: To determine the heat exchange Q in the cyclic process A→B→C→D→A, apply the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
The cyclic process involves states A, B, C, D with transitions: A to B (isothermal expansion), B to C (isobaric compression), C to D (isothermal compression), D to A (isobaric expansion).
For A to B (isothermal), work done is W_AB = nRT ln(V_B/V_A).
For B to C (isobaric), work done is W_BC = P ΔV = P (V_C - V_B).
For C to D (isothermal), work done is W_CD = nRT ln(V_D/V_C).
For D to A (isobaric), work done is W_DA = P ΔV = P (V_A - V_D).
Net work done W_net is the area enclosed by the cycle on the P-V diagram.
The net work done W_net is P ΔV = P (V_B - V_A).
Since the process is cyclic, ΔU = 0, thus Q = W_net.
From the diagram, pressure P is 1 x 10^5 Pa, and volume change ΔV is 1 L (from 3 L to 4 L).
Heat exchange Q is calculated as Q = P ΔV = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3) = 100 J.
The heat exchange Q between the gas and the outside world in the cyclic process is 100 J.
